greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Lexicographically earliest such sequence a that a(i) = a(j) => A122841(i) = A122841(j) and A244417(i) = A244417(j), for all i, j,
comment: Restricted growth sequence transform of the ordered pair [A122841(n), A244417(n)].
Essentially also the restricted growth sequence transform of the unordered pair {A007814(n), A007949(n)}.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..19683
Antti Karttunen, Data supplement: n, a(n) computed for n = 1..65537
program: rgs_transform(invec) = { my(om = Map(), outvec = vector(length(invec)), u=1); for(i=1, length(invec), if(mapisdefined(om,invec[i]), my(pp = mapget(om, invec[i])); outvec[i] = outvec[pp] , mapput(om,invec[i],i); outvec[i] = u; u++ )); outvec; };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 04 2018
